R.utils 2.12.0-9002
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Displays the contents of a text file with line numbers and more

displayCode.Rd

Displays the contents of a text file with line numbers and more.

# S3 method for default
displayCode(con=NULL, code=NULL, numerate=TRUE, lines=-1, wrap=79, highlight=NULL,
  pager=getOption("pager"), ...)

Arguments

con

A connection or a character string filename. If code is specified, this argument is ignored.

code

A character vector of code lines to be displayed.

numerate

If TRUE, line are numbers, otherwise not.

lines

If a single numeric, the maximum number of lines to show. If -1, all lines are shown. If a vector of numeric, the lines numbers to display.

wrap

The (output) column numeric where to wrap lines.

highlight

A vector of line number to be highlighted.

pager

If "none", code is not displayed in a pager, but only returned. For other options, see file.show().

...

Additional arguments passed to file.show(), which is used to display the formatted code.

Value

Returns (invisibly) the formatted code as a character string.

Author

Henrik Bengtsson

See also

file.show().

Examples

file <- system.file("DESCRIPTION", package="R.utils")
cat("Displaying: ", file, ":\n", sep="")
#> Displaying: /tmp/hb/RtmpuOz0om/temp_libpath3652077ec4613d/R.utils/DESCRIPTION:
displayCode(file)

file <- system.file("NEWS.md", package="R.utils")
cat("Displaying: ", file, ":\n", sep="")
#> Displaying: /tmp/hb/RtmpuOz0om/temp_libpath3652077ec4613d/R.utils/NEWS.md:
displayCode(file, numerate=FALSE, lines=100:110, wrap=65)

file <- system.file("NEWS.md", package="R.utils")
cat("Displaying: ", file, ":\n", sep="")
#> Displaying: /tmp/hb/RtmpuOz0om/temp_libpath3652077ec4613d/R.utils/NEWS.md:
displayCode(file, lines=100:110, wrap=65, highlight=c(101,104:108))
